page.title: 04Melchbourne Church
page.content: St. Mary Magdalen Church is a Grade 1 Listed Building. The original structure dates from 13th Century and the foundations and the tower remain Medieaval. The north porch is early 17th Century and is said to have come from Woodford House, Northamptonshire. The church was substantially remodelled in 18th Century, being commissioned by Samuel Whitbread, father in law to 12th Lord St. John of Bletsoe. It is now one of the largest churches in North Bedfordshire. The pews are all box pews dating from 1779. The St. John family pew in the chancel contains a fireplace, which was still in use in 1960's. Sadly, the church is great need of repair, suffering from dry rot, wet rot and death watch beetle. This work is now being undertaken.
